messages.text:
Did I miss a mailing list discussion?

Russ

I did follow the guidelines as it says "send mail to the mailing list to 
discuss" with a link to golang-nuts. So I opened a discussion on 
golang-nuts and was rejected for not a suited topic, and the nuts-onwer 
advised me to open a change and send a diff here. And I did.
Am I misguided?

On Tuesday, June 12, 2012 1:40:12 PM UTC+8, Andrew Gerrand wrote:
>
> On 12 June 2012 15:35,  <innocentsty@gmail.com> wrote: 
> > Sorry for not knowing the convention. And the reckless reimplementation 
> has 
> > been closed, for it's not as good as the standard one. 
>
> http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#Design is the relevant part of the 
> docs. 
>
> Thanks, 
> Andrew 
>
>
>
> > On Tuesday, June 12, 2012 1:22:12 PM UTC+8, Andrew Gerrand wrote: 
> >> 
> >> In case Russ' response wasn't clear, when contributing to the Go core 
> >> you need to discuss your intended changes before sending code. 
> >> 
> >> This rewrite of a core part of the standard library was sent with no 
> >> rationale, performance metrics, or any kind of discussion. 
>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

In case Russ' response wasn't clear, when contributing to the Go core
you need to discuss your intended changes before sending code.

This rewrite of a core part of the standard library was sent with no
rationale, performance metrics, or any kind of discussion.

On 12 June 2012 15:35,  <innocentsty@gmail.com> wrote:
> Sorry for not knowing the convention. And the reckless reimplementation has
> been closed, for it's not as good as the standard one.

http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#Design is the relevant part of the docs.

Thanks,
Andrew



> On Tuesday, June 12, 2012 1:22:12 PM UTC+8, Andrew Gerrand wrote:
>>
>> In case Russ' response wasn't clear, when contributing to the Go core
>> you need to discuss your intended changes before sending code.
>>
>> This rewrite of a core part of the standard library was sent with no
>> rationale, performance metrics, or any kind of discussion.

Sorry for not knowing the convention. And the reckless reimplementation has 
been closed, for it's not as good as the standard one.

On Tuesday, June 12, 2012 1:22:12 PM UTC+8, Andrew Gerrand wrote:
>
> In case Russ' response wasn't clear, when contributing to the Go core 
> you need to discuss your intended changes before sending code. 
>
> This rewrite of a core part of the standard library was sent with no 
> rationale, performance metrics, or any kind of discussion. 
>

On Tue, Jun 12, 2012 at 3:54 PM,  <innocentsty@gmail.com> wrote:

> I did follow the guidelines as it says "send mail to the mailing list to
> discuss" with a link to golang-nuts. So I opened a discussion on golang-nuts
> and was rejected for not a suited topic, and the nuts-onwer advised me to
> open a change and send a diff here. And I did.
> Am I misguided?

A mail to golang-dev would have been fine.

On 12 June 2012 15:54,  <innocentsty@gmail.com> wrote:
> I did follow the guidelines as it says "send mail to the mailing list to
> discuss" with a link to golang-nuts. So I opened a discussion on golang-nuts
> and was rejected for not a suited topic, and the nuts-onwer advised me to
> open a change and send a diff here. And I did.

Really? I never saw your mail to -nuts.

> Am I misguided?

No, that's appropriate. -nuts or -dev is fine.

> On Tuesday, June 12, 2012 1:40:12 PM UTC+8, Andrew Gerrand wrote:
>>
>> On 12 June 2012 15:35,  <innocentsty@gmail.com> wrote:
>> > Sorry for not knowing the convention. And the reckless reimplementation
>> > has
>> > been closed, for it's not as good as the standard one.
>>
>> http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#Design is the relevant part of the
>> docs.
>>
>> Thanks,
>> Andrew
>>
>>
>>
>> > On Tuesday, June 12, 2012 1:22:12 PM UTC+8, Andrew Gerrand wrote:
>> >>
>> >> In case Russ' response wasn't clear, when contributing to the Go core
>> >> you need to discuss your intended changes before sending code.
>> >>
>> >> This rewrite of a core part of the standard library was sent with no
>> >> rationale, performance metrics, or any kind of discussion.
